title: How to Draw a Bass Guitar

steps.headline: Draw a smaller triangle that is facing the opposite direction as the first one.
steps.description: These 2 triangles will be the body.

steps.headline: Draw a long, thin rectangle between the two triangles.
steps.description: This will act as the fret board.

steps.headline: Draw 2 opposing triangles at the end of the rectangle.
steps.description: The one connected to the rectangle should be smaller. Add a circle at the end of the bigger triangle.

steps.headline: Draw an oval over the end of the 2 big triangles.
steps.description: This will help you draw the curves of the guitar body.

steps.headline: Add the details.
steps.description: Draw 8 small circles connected by 8 lines at the end of the fret board. Draw several rectangles and circle at the body for the pickup and the knobs (volume, tone etc...)

steps.headline: Ink the drawing and erase the sketch.

text: Draw a slanted triangle.  Draw a smaller triangle that is facing the opposite direction as the first one. These 2 triangles will be the body. Draw a long, thin rectangle between the two triangles. This will act as the fret board. Draw 2 opposing triangles at the end of the rectangle. The one connected to the rectangle should be smaller. Add a circle at the end of the bigger triangle. Draw an oval over the end of the 2 big triangles. This will help you draw the curves of the guitar body. Add the details. Draw 8 small circles connected by 8 lines at the end of the fret board. Draw several rectangles and circle at the body for the pickup and the knobs (volume, tone etc...) Ink the drawing and erase the sketch.  Color it. Admire your new drawing!
